definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
basin/flower pot/unit of volume equal to 12 斗[dou3] and 8 升[sheng1], approx 128 liters/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: A simple compass is helpful for scribing the flowerpot cutouts.
sentences.chinese: 一个简单的指南针，是有助于划线的花盆切口。

sentences.english: The flowers were in their pots.
If you plan to keep it outside full time, holes in the bottom are okay.
sentences.chinese: 如果你打算将植物一直放在外面，花盆底下有洞较好。

sentences.english: You can make your own spiffy pots out of black-and-white newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用黑白报纸制作自己漂亮的花盆。

sentences.english: The pots are in the drying process.
He potted up the rose cuttings.
sentences.chinese: 他把玫瑰花的插枝种在花盆内。

sentences.english: Pop in the border or pots.
sentences.chinese: 突然就开在了花床或花盆上。

sentences.english: She tells him not to break the flowerpot.
sentences.chinese: 她告诉他，不要把花盆打破。

sentences.english: I'll put them in a flower pot, and you can take them right with you.
sentences.chinese: 我把它们栽到一个花盆里，你再带走。

sentences.english: He says most flowerpots are never re-used.
sentences.chinese: 他说，大多数的花盆是永远不会重新使用。

sentences.english: It is mainly used as the mat of flowerpot and others decorative objects.
sentences.chinese: 用作花盆底垫或其他装饰物品的底垫。

sentences.english: They can also be found in soil and potting mix.
sentences.chinese: 它们还可在土壤和花盆混合土中找到。

sentences.english: He points out that traditional flowerpots made from petroleum-based plastics can last much longer.
sentences.chinese: 他指出石油塑料制成的传统花盆可以持续很长时间。

sentences.english: The flowers were growing in pots.
The procedure detailed here focuses on extraction of spores from greenhouse-grown pot cultures.
sentences.chinese: 详细步骤集中在从温室选取花盆栽培的种子。
